metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML Paragraphs
A paragraph always starts on a new line, and is usually a block of text.
content.html: A paragraph always starts on a new line, and is usually a block of text.

content.text: HTML Paragraphs

The HTML

element defines a paragraph.
content.html: The HTML <p> element defines a paragraph.

content.text: A paragraph always starts on a new line, and browsers automatically add some white space (a margin) before and after a paragraph.
content.html: A paragraph always starts on a new line, and browsers automatically add some white space (a margin) before and after a paragraph.

content.code:
This is a paragraph.

This is another paragraph.
content.code_html:
<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>

content.text: HTML Display
You cannot be sure how HTML will be displayed.
content.html: You cannot be sure how HTML will be displayed.

content.text: Large or small screens, and resized windows will create different results.
content.html: Large or small screens, and resized windows will create different results.

content.text: With HTML, you cannot change the display by adding extra spaces or extra lines in your HTML code.
content.html: With HTML, you cannot change the display by adding extra spaces or extra lines in your HTML code.

content.text: The browser will automatically remove any extra spaces and lines when the page is displayed:
content.html: The browser will automatically remove any extra spaces and lines when the page is displayed:

content.code:
This paragraph contains a lot of lines in the source code, but the browser ignores it.

This paragraph contains         a lot of spaces in the source         code, but the        browser ignores it.
content.code_html:
<p>
This paragraph
contains a lot of lines
in the source code,
but the browser
ignores it.
</p>

<p>
This paragraph
contains         a lot of spaces
in the source         code,
but the        browser
ignores it.
</p>

content.text: HTML Horizontal Rules
The <hr> tag defines a thematic break in an HTML page, and is most often displayed as a horizontal rule.
content.html: The <hr> tag defines a thematic break in an HTML page, and is most often displayed as a horizontal rule.

content.text: The <hr> element is used to separate content (or define a change) in an HTML page:
content.html: The <hr> element is used to separate content (or define a change) in an HTML page:

content.code:
This is heading 1

This is some text.

This is heading 2

This is some other text.
content.code_html:
<h1>This is heading 1</h1>
<p>This is some text.</p>
<hr>
<h2>This is heading 2</h2>
<p>This is some other text.</p>
<hr>

content.text: The <hr> tag is an empty tag, which means that it has no end tag.
content.html: The <hr> tag is an empty tag, which means that it has no end tag.

content.text: HTML Line Breaks

The HTML
element defines a line break.
content.html: The HTML <br> element defines a line break.

content.text:
Use
if you want a line break (a new line) without starting a new paragraph:
content.html: Use <br> if you want a line break (a new line) without starting a new paragraph:

content.code_html: <p>This is<br>a paragraph<br>with line breaks.</p>

content.text:
The
tag is an empty tag, which means that it has no end tag.
content.html: The <br> tag is an empty tag, which means that it has no end tag.

content.text: The Poem Problem
This poem will display on a single line:
content.html: This poem will display on a single line:

content.code: My Bonnie lies over the ocean.   My Bonnie lies over the sea.   My Bonnie lies over the ocean.   Oh, bring back my Bonnie to me.
content.code_html:
<p>
  My Bonnie lies over the ocean.

  My Bonnie lies over the sea.

  My Bonnie lies over the ocean.

  Oh, bring back my Bonnie to me.
</p>

content.text: Solution - The HTML <pre> Element
The HTML <pre> element defines preformatted text.
content.html: The HTML <pre> element defines preformatted text.

content.text: The text inside a <pre> element is displayed in a fixed-width font (usually Courier), and it preserves both spaces and line breaks:
content.html: The text inside a <pre> element is displayed in a fixed-width font (usually Courier), and it preserves both spaces and line breaks:

content.code:
My Bonnie lies over the ocean.


  My Bonnie lies over the sea.

  My Bonnie lies over the 
ocean.

  Oh, bring back my Bonnie to me.
content.code_html:
<pre>
  My Bonnie lies over the ocean.

  My Bonnie lies over the sea.

  My Bonnie lies over the ocean.

  Oh, bring back my Bonnie to me.
</pre>

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
True or False. HTML paragraphs always starts on a new line.
content.html: True or False. HTML paragraphs always starts on a new line.

metadata.question: True or False. HTML paragraphs always starts on a new line.

content.question: True or False. HTML paragraphs always starts on a new line.

content.text: HTML Tag Reference
W3Schools' tag reference contains additional information about HTML elements and their attributes.
content.html: W3Schools' tag reference contains additional information about HTML elements and their attributes.

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<p> Defines a paragraph
<hr> Defines a thematic change in the content
<br> Inserts a single line break
<pre> Defines pre-formatted text

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
